      Create default CSV file from most recently-downloaded path.

      java.io.FileNotFoundException - in the case that a file does not exist at that path.

    • CsvFile

      public CsvFile​(java.nio.file.Path pathToFile) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Create default CSV file from specified path.
      Parameters:
      pathToFile - Path path to the CSV file.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - in the case that a file does not exist at that path.

    • CsvFile

      public CsvFile​(java.nio.file.Path pathToFile, org.apache.commons.csv.CSVFormat format) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Create a CSV file with the given file format from the CSV file at the specified path.
      Parameters:
      pathToFile - Path path to the CSV file.
      format - CSVFormat the format of the CSV file. See CSVFormat documentation for more info.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - in the case that a file does not exist at that path.

    • CsvFile

      public CsvFile​(int numberOfHeaderRows) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Create a CSV file configured with the given number of header rows from the CSV file at the most recently downloaded path.
      Parameters:
      numberOfHeaderRows - int number of header rows in the CSV file.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - in the case that a file does not exist at that path.

    • CsvFile

      public CsvFile​(java.nio.file.Path pathToFile, int numberOfHeaderRows) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Create a CSV file configured with the given number of header rows from the CSV file at the given path.
      Parameters:
      pathToFile - Path path to the CSV file.
      numberOfHeaderRows - int number of header rows in the CSV file.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - in the case that a file does not exist at that path.

    • CsvFile

      public CsvFile​(java.nio.file.Path pathToFile, org.apache.commons.csv.CSVFormat format, int numberOfHeaderRows) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Create a CSV file configured with the given number of header rows and CSVFormat from the CSV file at the given path.
      Parameters:
      pathToFile - Path path to the CSV file.
      format - CSVFormat the format of the CSV file. See CSVFormat documentation for more info.
      numberOfHeaderRows - int number of header rows in the CSV file.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - in the case that a file does not exist at that path.

    • getNumberOfDataRows

      public int getNumberOfDataRows()
      Returns the number of rows of data in the CSV file. Does not include header rows.
      Returns:
      int the number of data rows in the CSV file. Does not include header rows.

    • readRowData

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> readRowData​(int rowIndex)
      Returns a List<String> consisting of each value in a given row. The row index starts at 1 and factors out the header rows, so that calling this method with rowIndex=1 gets the first row with actual data.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - int index of the first row with real data, starting at 1, taking into consideration row headers.
      Returns:
      List<String> consisting of each value in a given row.

    • readCellData

      public java.lang.String readCellData​(int columnIndex, int rowIndex)
      Returns the value at the given column, row in the file. The row index starts at 1 and factors out the header rows, so that calling this method with rowIndex=1 gets the first row with actual data.
      Parameters:
      columnIndex - int index of the column, starting at 1
      rowIndex - int index of the first row with real data, starting at 1, taking into consideration row headers.
      Returns:
      String the data in the specified cell.

    • readCellData

      public java.lang.String readCellData​(java.lang.String columnHeader, int rowIndex)
      Returns the value at the given column, row in the file. The row index starts at 1 and factors out the header rows, so that calling this method with rowIndex=1 gets the first row with actual data.
      Parameters:
      columnHeader - String name of the column
      rowIndex - int index of the first row with real data, starting at 1, taking into consideration row headers.
      Returns:
      String the data in the specified cell.

    • readAllFileContents

      public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> readAllFileContents()
      Creates a list of lists, each list being a set of values for each row in the file.
      Returns:
      List<List<String>> All contents of the file.

    • readHeaders

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> readHeaders()
      Returns a List<String> consisting of the header values in the row right above where the actual data starts. This depends on numHeaderRows, set when creating the file. If numHeaderRows < 1, this method throws. If numHeaderRows > 1, this method returns the last header row above the actual data.
      Returns:
      List<String> consisting of the header values

    • writeFileContents

      public void writeFileContents​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> newFileContents)
      Sets the whole file's contents to the passed newFileContents values, where each list of lists is a row.
      Parameters:
      newFileContents - List<List<String>> All contents of the file to write.

    • verifyCellDataContains

      public java.lang.String verifyCellDataContains​(int rowIndex, java.lang.String columnHeader, java.lang.String textToMatch, boolean partialMatch)
      Verifies the cell in the given row and column contains or equals the given text.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - int index of the row, starting at 1.
      columnHeader - String name of the column.
      textToMatch - String text to check in the cell.
      partialMatch - boolean if true, text match is 'contains'. if false, text match is 'equals'.
      Returns:
      boolean true if the cell contains/has the given text.

    • verifyCellDataContains

      public java.lang.String verifyCellDataContains​(int rowIndex, int columnIndex, java.lang.String textToMatch, boolean partialMatch)
      Verifies the cell in the given row and column contains or equals the given text.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - int index of the row, starting at 1.
      columnIndex - int index of the column, starting at 1.
      textToMatch - String text to check in the cell.
      partialMatch - boolean if true, text match is 'contains'. if false, text match is 'equals'.
      Returns:
      boolean true if the cell contains/has the given text.

    • verifyAllColumnCellsContain

      public boolean verifyAllColumnCellsContain​(java.lang.String columnHeader, java.lang.String textToMatch, boolean partialMatch)
      Returns true if all cells in the given column match the text value given.
      Parameters:
      columnHeader - String the name of the column
      textToMatch - String the text that should be in every cell
      partialMatch - boolean if true, method returns true if each cell contains the textToMatch. if false, method returns true if every cell equals the textToMatch.
      Returns:
      boolean true if the column contains the given text in every cell, false if not

    • verifyAllColumnCellsContain

      public boolean verifyAllColumnCellsContain​(int columnIndex, java.lang.String textToMatch, boolean partialMatch)
      Returns true if all cells in the given column match the text value given.
      Parameters:
      columnIndex - int the index of the column. Starting at 1.
      textToMatch - String the text that should be in every cell
      partialMatch - boolean if true, method returns true if each cell contains the textToMatch. if false, method returns true if every cell equals the textToMatch.
      Returns:
      boolean true if the column contains the given text in every cell, false if not

    • verifyAllColumnCellsEmpty

      public boolean verifyAllColumnCellsEmpty​(java.lang.String columnHeader)
      Returns true if all cells in the given column are empty.
      Parameters:
      columnHeader - String name of the column.
      Returns:
      boolean true if all cells are empty, false otherwise (any cell has content).

    • verifyAllColumnCellsEmpty

      public boolean verifyAllColumnCellsEmpty​(int columnIndex)
      Returns true if all cells in the given column are empty.
      Parameters:
      columnIndex - int index of the column, starting at 1.
      Returns:
      boolean true if all cells are empty, false otherwise (any cell has content).

    • verifyAllColumnCellsNotEmpty

      public boolean verifyAllColumnCellsNotEmpty​(java.lang.String columnHeader)
      Returns true if all cells in the given columns are not empty (all cells have content).
      Parameters:
      columnHeader - String name of the column.
      Returns:
      boolean true if all cells are not empty, false otherwise (any cell does not have content).

    • verifyAllColumnCellsNotEmpty

      Parameters:
      columnIndex - int index of the column, starting at 1.
      Returns:
      boolean true if all cells are not empty, false otherwise (any cell does not have content).

    • verifyColumnHeaderEquals

      public boolean verifyColumnHeaderEquals​(java.lang.String columnHeader, boolean partialMatch)
      Returns true if the csv file has the given header. If partialMatch == true, then the comparison is a "contains", meaning this method will return true if any column contains the given columnHeader. If partialMatch == false, then this comparison is an "equals", meaning this method will return true only if any column exactly matches the given columnHeader.
      Parameters:
      columnHeader - String name of the column to check existence of.
      partialMatch - boolean true if the comparison should be "contains", false if comparison should be "equals".
      Returns:
      boolean true if the csv file has a column header matching the given columnHeader

    • verifyAnyColumnCellContains

      public boolean verifyAnyColumnCellContains​(java.lang.String columnHeader, java.lang.String textToMatch, boolean partialMatch)
      Returns true if any cell in the given column match the text value given.
      Parameters:
      columnHeader - String the name of the column
      textToMatch - String the text that should be in a cell
      partialMatch - boolean if true, method returns true if any cell contains the textToMatch. if false, method returns true if any cell equals the textToMatch.
      Returns:
      boolean true if the column contains the given text in any cell, false if not

    • verifyAnyColumnCellContains

      public boolean verifyAnyColumnCellContains​(int columnIndex, java.lang.String textToMatch, boolean partialMatch)
      Returns true if any cells in the given column match the text value given.
      Parameters:
      columnIndex - int the index of the column. Starting at 1.
      textToMatch - String the text that should be in a cell
      partialMatch - boolean if true, method returns true if any cell contains the textToMatch. if false, method returns true if any cell equals the textToMatch.
      Returns:
      boolean true if the column contains the given text in any cell, false if not
